yeah for sure but anxiety and panic falls more in a sense of loss of control. and while he certainly sounded like that his actions were him like taking that head on, erroneously but still.
imo he looked manic. but yeah def anxious. like the way he sounded and looked is how anxious people and panic attack people feel but it's usually more internalized if that makes sense. taht's thesoundtrack running through their head but they're not running around to do something about it.
everyone's different though and mental illness sure isn't something to box in. still symptoms are indicative of certain things so that they are identifiable. my bad, didn't want to contradict myself too much there.

I'm a bit on the fence for piracy. I dont think it's right to feel you're entitled to any and everything whenever you want. I mean ultimately the piracy system would buckle the media it's stealing if everyone did it. Nothing would be profitable. Records and movies barely are as it is too.
IP and copyright laws are important. I kind of hate how piravy gets lumped into the privacy debate.

not that it's a gleaming example of privacy i do believe google encrypts or offers options to encrypt yourself.
Although maybe you just encrupt your account, i'm not sure actually.
I do know like 60% of their email sent on their own servers are encrypted. As much as they use the data on you for advertising purposes on a near creepy scale/level, they do offer decent protection from outside intruders.

or legal. I think it's probably also done in the event the FBI or someone requested it.

That's what I was thinking. Like duuuuuuuuude cars are sliding down a hill toward your truck on ice. And you're just like fuck you fuck you fuck you, no you're *not* cool, fuck you too! I'm going up bitches!
That you don't want to walk the 40 feet to put the cones out a bit more for your own sake? Drop the machismo self righteousness dude and be smart. Eh darwin in action.
lol hitting the truck and not killing him might even get you paid!

That's what I thought too a sign at top of the hill and a bit more distance between the cones. Can't force it to one lane for too long or force it to one lane too close to the hill but certainly could have done a bit more.
The irony is that with a accidents and slide offs occurring he is at risk of being hit regardless of his trucks position. Being that it was to teh side of him and not more behind him it'd be easy for a car to hit it and then him or slide off and miss the tuck altogether.
Especially going up in the bucket. I don't know how he felt safe doing that with people sliding all over the place down the hill. I'm sure the truck's designed to take some hits with someone up there the best it can but still seems like a situation to avoid at all costs. In a case where there's increased risk or probability of it occurring i'd want to take as much preventative and safety as possible.

His explanation for a cone per every 10/mph i think is probably applied over the distance you're supposed to be able to stop at that speed. So it'd be a cone every ten feet and obviously not done out of laziness.
To be fair with road conditions like that and a hill that you lose visibility on you should be going a lot slower. Not that I would either or actually i probably would having had some experience with loss of visibility on hills. But either way, I get it and human nature won't necessarily.
And he can't put the cones too far back since he's forcing it to one lane. Need to have the space and visibility of what's going on after the hill altogether so people aren't going in the other direction into oncoming traffic. Sign on the poke for Slow Roadwork would work probably. Or even just pushed out for more space, still making a longer stretch reduced to one lane and might cause a back up and hazard to people going over the hill.
Still more safety could be implemented here just running through scenarios in my head.

NOLA keeps up. But when a bar is closing at 2AM and people are all like going home. You're all like, where to next? House Party? After hours spot?
What's that? They say. You're like uh, okay then.
The early closing time maybe makes it more conducive to like one night stands cause it's earlier. Even Baltimore wasn't that rowdy. I mean while places were open it was but once it closes down it's like welp, that's that. Philly too.

As a NYC resident, who done a bit of both those 6, 7, 9 am, two day nights while hard to remember are hard to top.
Shit like this is fun too though. Just more...there's a uniqueness to it and a 'special' sense since you're taking the weekend and going somewhere.
The chance to spend every weekend partying till dawn, or even a Tuesday or Thursday while seemingly Mundane after a year or two was still fun. And most people might look at that as some big city life shit that they'd want to give a shot if they could.

Dude, you don't have a clue what you're talking about it.
It isn't that it's entirely ethical. It's that it's *more* ethical.
And it's within reason. Beef isn't. You'll never get people to stop eating meat. But if you get them to stop eating beef, you'd do the world some good. Plus the argument wouldn't be from how you feel but on something that makes a bit more sense.

sustainable isn't a relative term. you have to look at the big picture. one. is it practical to try and get everyone to stop eating meet? nope. is it safe or reasonable? nope. are chickens a good in between? absolutely compared to other meats.
we already grow enough crop for humans. expecting people to change what they grow so there's more protein oriented crop when the market doesn't demand it is insane. people need to make a living and feed themselves too.
not everyone's body type and biological make up takes to vegetarianism or veganism either. some people are cut out great for it, others not so much.
We probably shouldn't eat fish either i guess or eggs or milk...
fuck it, you're right. idealism *always* wins.
sike, the market does!

chicken's aren't the problem though. They're a great, sustainable, source of meat.
